name: Sash of Fortitude
description: You gain a +1 to Wisdom. As a bonus action, you can cast a spell into the Sash. Glowing like a warm hearth, you emit an aura of 10ft around you that lasts for 1 minute or until you fall unconscious. This aura provides a bonus to AC equal to the spell level cast into the sash divided by two.
lore: “My clan leader used to wear this. They are no more. As a thanks for helping me escape.” - Lily Matterhorn

name: War Mage Hood
description: As a bonus action, you may raise the hood. With the hood raised, it acts as a spellcasting focus for you. The requirement of a free hand is waved for spells requiring somatic components as well. Additionally, you may wield two shields at the same time, gaining the benefits from both. Lastly, as a bonus action, you can command all allies within 60ft that can hear you. They can use their reaction to take an action immediately. This can only be used once per day.
lore: Woven specifically for generals in wizard armies. Those that wear it immediately garner respect and attention.

name: Ring of Evocation
description: At dawn, gain 1d4+4 charges to a maximum of 8. While wearing the ring, you may spend an action to expend 1 or more charges to cast any Evocation spell you know without expending spell slots, instead expending charges equal to the level. Additionally, when a creature makes an attack roll against you, you may gain resistance to acid, cold, fire, and lightning damage until the start of your next turn. This can used a number of times per day equal to your proficiency bonus. Lastly, at dawn you may choose a damage type, all spells that deal that damage type have a +2 to their attack roll or a +2 to their save DC.
lore: Damn, why couldn’t I have been conscripted into the Sultan’s Army? This is nice!

name: Bull's Eye Bracers
description:
Every consecutive successful attack made with a ranged weapon while wearing these bracers increases your damage bonus by 1. This extra bonus begins at 0, increasing up to a maximum of 10, and persists in between turns. It resets back to 0 if you use your action to do anything other than an attack with your ranged weapon on your turn, or if you fail to hit your target with an attack roll.

During a long rest, you may choose one synergy that the Bracers gain. The attuned creature must have the associated feat to pick that synergy:
Archery Fighting Style: You can use a bonus action to give yourself advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can only use this feature if you haven't moved during this turn, and after using it, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.
Sharpshooter Feat: You can choose to take an extra -2 penalty to the attack roll, and if that attack hits, you roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the attack's damage.
Crossbow Expert Feat: If you attack a creature within 5 feet of you with a hand crossbow, or within 10 feet of you with a heavy crossbow, their damage dice increase to a d8 and a d12 respectively.
Elven Accuracy Feat: While wearing these bracers, ranged weapon attacks up to 60 feet made in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, are not made at disadvantage.
lore: Made out of leather. Indeed. Made out of finely tanned leather. Indeed. Made out of an actual Bull’s Eye. Perhaps.

name: General Flintbrace's Dagger
description: When you get hit by an attack, you may use your reaction to parry the attack and gaina temporary +2 AC.
lore: Amazingly small. Even small by halfling standards.

name: Mariner's Armor
description: While wearing this armor, you have a swim speed equal to your walking speed. Additionally, whenever you start your turn underwater with 0 hp, you automatically rise 60ft towards the surface.
lore: “It reminds me of the mermaids,” Guillver says as he looks upon the seashell armor.

name: Banana Armor
description: Gain +5 movement speed and the ability to disengage as a bonus action. Additionally, the banana armor holds 3 charges, regaining 1d4-1 at dawn. For 1 charge you can cast Blur or Mirror Image on yourself as a bonus action (no concentration needed). As the charges deplete the banana armor fades from yellow to brown.
lore: Do you want a banana? Peel it down and go mm mm mm mm.

name: Adamantine Plate
description: While wearing, any crit against you becomes a normal hit.
lore: A black metal with a greenish hue, adamantine seems to absorb an unnatural amount of force.

name: Triceratops Hide
description: +1 Studded Leather Armor
lore: It’s kind of tough, are you sure you stretched it correctly? I’m a medium, and this is fitting me like a small.

name: Dwarven Plate
description: If an effect moves you against your will along the ground, you can use your reaction to reduce the distance you are moved by up to 10 feet.
lore: The gold accents glimmer like the hoards of Dwarven Kings.

name: Crown of Faenor
description: When worn, every gemstone you find is worth 50% more. Additionally, every 10 minutes you heal 1d6 health.
lore: An ornate mithral crown worn by the Stone Giant King Faenor, a noble giant who fell victim to the Mithral Craze. Pray the craze does not fall upon you next.
curse: Cursed </br> You have a strong urge to collect wealth

name: Helm of the Juggernaut
description: After you take the dash action on your turn, you can make one melee attack.
lore: You are the ram of the highest mountains. You are the lightning that will strike. You are the unstoppable force.

name: Crown of the Marid
description: Once per day, the wearer can cast Control Water.
lore: Waves roll with the flick of your wrist and rivers part with the nod of your head.

name: Autumn's Pumpkin
description:
While wearing, gain a +1 to AC and advantage on perception checks. Once per day, the wearer may cast See Invisibility as a bonus action. Additionally, Autumn’s Pumpkin may be master-crafted with certain materials to transform it into one of its forms. It will stay transformed until the beginning of next year’s Autumn.
King Harvest Form
Crafting Requirement: 300gp of Gourds
Resist Bludgeoning Damage
1/day you can activate your Harvest Dance. While active, the ground in a 15 ft radius around you sprouts gourds for 1 minute. All hostile creatures treat this ground as difficult terrain.
Fire-Fallow Form
Crafting Requirement: Crafted by a Fire Giant or in a forge fueled by a Dragon’s Fire Breath
Resist Fire Damage
1/day you can activate your Harsh Hearth. While active, the air in a 15 ft radius ignites for 1 minute. At the start of your turn, all hostile creatures in the radius take 2d4 fire damage.
lore: A jovial comrade who brings bountiful harvest to all who request or a feared inquisitor who demands proper tribute? Which will you be?

name: Peregrine Mask
description: While wearing this winged helm, you have a flying speed of 60 feet. In addition, you have advantage on initiative rolls.
lore: Fly like an eagle, to the sea. Fly like an eagle, let my spirit carry me.

name: Crown of the Mithral Anthers
description: When worn, you cannot be knocked prone, gain +1 to AC, and may treat falling objects as solid ground.
lore: The antlers fell off the elk’s body, almost too easily. In your hands, the antlers tremble. But no one else notices. You aren’t even sure if you were supposed to notice.
curse: Cursed </br>  Living mithral begins invading your veins. Gain a weakness to psychic damage. If you fall unconscious while wearing it, the mithral takes over. Roll death saves as normal. However, the living mithral acts on your turn, attacking the nearest living thing.

name: Animated Shield
description: While holding this shield, you can speak its command word as a bonus action to cause it to animate. The shield leaps into the air and hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free. The shield remains animated for 1 minute, until you use a bonus action to end this effect, or until you are incapacitated or die, at which point the shield falls to the ground or into your hand if you have one free.
lore: This shield is dancing on its own.

name: Rings of Seaver
description: You may attune to as many of these rings as you wish, and they will only take one attunement slot. When you roll a Natural 20 you can then grant a Natural 20 to an ally’s next d20 roll, one that can hear you. When this is done, that ring cracks and it no longer has this magical property
lore: Rumor speaks that if one stares too long, glimpses of your birth and death are reenacted in the refractions of the orange topazes these rings are set with.

name: Ring of Protection
description: When attuned to this ring, gain a +1 to AC and all Saving Throws
lore: Though a simple ring, the dwarves are quite proud of this enchantment, even going so far as to bring it up whenever possible.

name: Ring of Longevity
description: While worn the wearer ages at a slower rate. For every 100 years that pass only 1 year passes for the wearer. Additionally, the wearer is immune to aging effects of all kinds.
lore: he fountain of youth is pure hogwash, and this ring belongs with it. Bah humbug! I’m wearing this ring and I’ve still got my damn wrinkles!

name: Ring of Spell Storing
description: This ring can store up to 5 levels worth of spells into it. Any creature can cast spells into it. While attuned, you can cast the stored spells in the ring regardless if you can typically cast spells. The casted spells use the original caster’s spell save DC, spell attack bonus, spellcasting ability, and spell level. But, you are treated as the current caster (for counterspell and concentration purposes). Once cast, the spell leaves the ring and frees up the space it was taking up.
lore: “This ring carried me through thick and thin. A backup revivify comes in more handy than you think” - Otto, retired halfling adventurer

name: Ring of Blagothikus
description: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only you (not in an area of effect). In addition, if you roll a 20 for the save and the spell is 7th level or lower, the spell has no effect on you and instead targets the caster.
lore: With a single ring, the empire of the giants crumbled. A millennium of rule reduced to rumble and ruin.
curse: Cursed </br>You have disadvantage on all rolls involving a giant

name: Ring of Spell Turning
description: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only you (not in an area of effect). In addition, if you roll a 20 for the save and the spell is 7th level or lower, the spell has no effect on you and instead targets the caster.
lore: This metal, Nidastál, shimmers like mithral and hardens like adamantine. We’ll have to keep an eye out for this.

name: Ring of Evasion
description: This ring holds a maximum of 3 charges, regaining 1d3 charges at dawn. When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to spend a charge and succeed instead.
lore: Dodge, duck, dip, dive, and dodge

name: Ring of Peterbrugge
description: As an action, you can cast the spell invisibility on yourself. This ignores all components and you do not need concentration.
lore: The ring levitates over the split remains of its adamantine prison. It flickers, phasing in and out of reality. Perhaps there’s more to this than it appears.

name: Necklace of Ukko
description: Gives the wearer proficiency in INT Saving Throws
lore: A Necklace gifted to D’al D’ar from his god, Ukko

name: Love Locket of the River King
description: A golden heart-shaped locket that is activated by speaking its command phrase to it (“I love you”). For the next minute, you gain a +1 to all d20 rolls. After using this feature, you must sleep and dream of the River King in order to let it recharge.
lore: Opening the locket is a tasteful photo of the River King. He lays nude, legs spread, a rose in his mouth, and a sizable trout covering his nether regions.

name: Brooch of Shielding
description: When worn, you gain resistance to force damage and immunity from the magic missile spell.
lore: Required Protection Item #34: Brooch of Shielding.</br>When traversing through all stable or unstable planar portals, all Knights of the Gate are required to wear their issued Brooch of Shielding. If your Brooch is damaged, tampered with, or inconsistent in any way please talk to your Supervising Paladin for ways to remedy the situation.

name: Hydra's Amulet
description: The amulet depicts a hydra with four of its five heads slain off. If you take 30 damage from a single attack from a hostile creature that is not fire damage, one of those heads grows back. Based on how many heads are on the amulet, you gain the benefits of that level and all the previous:</br></br>One Head: +1 to spell save DC and spell attack rolls</br>Two Heads: Instead, +2 to spell save DC and spell attack rolls</br>Three Heads: Advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or incapacitated</br>Four Heads: Instead, +3 to spell save DC and spell attack rolls</br>Five Heads: +2 to one mental stat of your choice and +2 to its maximum
lore: For appearing out of the gizzard of a fallen hydra, it is a bit more intricate than you would have guessed

name: Slingstaff
description: At dawn, this staff gains 1d6+1 charges, up to a maximum of 15 charges. As an action, you can cast magic missile at level 1 for 1 charge. You can increase the spell slot level for each additional charge you spend on it. Additionally, you can make a ranged weapon attack (30/120) with the slingshot on top for 1d6 bludgeoning damage. On a critical hit, this weapon deals triple damage instead of double.
lore: Even though it was made by the hands of the halfling, the slingstaff begs for its wielder to be tall.

name: Ancient Treant Staff
description: A simple +1 Quarterstaff, but it can be mastercraft with some metal to make a magical polearm.
lore: Old Man Willow’s last gift to the world, and last gift from all the Treants.

name: Immovable Rod
description: With a button on one end of this iron rod, you may use your action to press the button and activate the rod. When active, the rod becomes magically fixed in place, unable to move (even by gravity) until another creature presses the button. The rod can hold up to 8000 lbs before deactivating. Lastly, A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, moving the fixed rod up to 10 feet on a success.
lore: Fuck…the button’s jammed again.

name: True Equilibrium
description: Magical greatsword that deals an additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage on hit.
lore: The gusts of the wind dragons back every slice.

name: Evergrow Club
description: A magical club made of winewood, gifted by the Fruit King. At dawn, 1d8 goodberries grow upon itself.
lore: The berries taste of jokes and laughter, drawing you back to the Fruit King’s Court for another party.

name: Spear of Certain Death
description: When you damage a creature, that creature cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn.
lore: Reeking of undeath, noses revolt at just the mere sight of its sharpened tip and the wounds it carves do not fade with time.

name: Axe in the Stump
description: Gain advantage on survival checks and gain 2 temporary hit points per character level. These hit points regenerate at dawn
lore: Rumor holds that whoever can pull the axe from the stump is destined to rule all forests and navigate even the most formidable underbrush.

name: Warhammer of the Swamp
description: When wet from water, double the warhammer damage dice.
lore: Hailing from the elemental plane of water, all experienced aquanauts have mastery over this weapon.

name: Vinethorn Rapier
description: This rapier has +5 reach and deals an additional 1d6 piercing damage.
lore: An extension of your body, the vinethorn will even have roses bloom on the blade when you’re happy.

name: Weaponary Mimic
description: Link for Description
lore: Raised from birth, mimics are tools for the mindflayers. Not animals or pets or equals

name: Pike of the Vigilant Watchman
description: While attuned, you can’t be magically put to sleep, only need to sleep once per week, and can add your proficiency bonus to your damage rolls.
lore: Shit! It’s like caffeine in a blade.

name: Fool's Blade
description:
While wielding this blade, you get the following benefits:
Fool’s Feint: As a bonus action, you can feint, choosing a creature within 5 feet of you as your target. Until the start of your next turn, you have advantage on attack rolls against the target. This can be used only once per day.
Misdirect : When a creature within 60 feet of you targets you with an attack, you can use your reaction to make the creature make a DC15 INT ST. On a failed save, the attack targets another creature of your choice that is within the attacker’s reach. This can be used only once per day.
lore: The blade flickers and shimmers, distorting its location to all observers. Even the greatest sword master can’t help but yield when dueling this blade.

name: Class IV Somsarian Dagger
description: This dagger has an increased crit range, landing a critical hit on a 19 and 20. Additionally, on a crit, the hit creature glows until the start of your next turn. Any attack roll against a glowing creature has advantage.
lore: As is standard in all Emeraldhorn products, when killed, a creature’s last breath, regardless if it can speak or not, utters “Slain by an Emeraldhorn blade”

name: Class II Weltzman Glaive
description: At dawn, choose a type of damage. The glaive deals an extra 1d6 of that damage type for the day. When dealing the killing blow to a creature, you gain temporary hp equivalent to the damage dealt in that finishing strike.
lore: A note accompanies this glaive. It reads, “To the start of a beautiful partnership.” It’s signed by Emeraldhorn himself and has a bottle of Dragondew White Wine. How lucky you are!

name: Oathbow
description: Once per day, as part of an attack with this bow, you can make the target your sworn enemy. When you make a ranged attack against your sworn enemy, you get advantage. Additionally, your sworn enemy doesn’t benefit from cover  (besides total) and they take an additional 3d6 piercing on hit. While your sworn enemy is alive, attacking with other weapons is done with disadvantage.
lore: With every release of the bowstring, another arrow befalls my enemy. May swift death befall you.

name: Repeating Crossbow
description: When you make an attack, the crossbow fires three arrows at once. Roll to hit once for all the arrows, but roll damage for each individually. These arrows can target either one target or multiple.
lore: I’m going to need a bigger quiver.

name: Arezlor's Bracer
description: These magic bracers increase in power based on the giants the wearer has slain. Once per day for 1 minute, you can activate your bracers as a bonus action, increasing your size</br></br><u>iant’s Slain and Benefits</u></br><b>Hill Giant</br>: +1 to attacks</br><b>Stone Giant</br>: +2 to attacks </br><b>Fire Giant</br>: +2 to attacks, size changed to large </br><b>Storm Giant</br>: +3 to attacks, size changed to large </br><b>Fog Giant</br>: +3 to attacks, size changed to huge
lore: Let giants weep at your feet, for Arezlor’s message persists past his death.

name: Water Whip
description: A whip with a range of 25 feet that on hit deals an additional 3d6 cold damage. Additionally, the target must succeed on a DC 17 STR Saving Throw or be pulled up to 20 feet towards the user.
lore: It’s wet to the touch, awkward to handle, and obtuse at first glance; however, once it’s learned, it feels as natural as an Octopus’ tentacles.

name: Translucent War Pick
description:
While attuned, all spells that deal piercing or force damage are upcast by 1 level for free. Additionally, when brought to the Ethereal Plane and let sit for one hour, it transforms into the:
Elysian War Pick:The spells are now upcast by 2 levels for free
lore: I’ve stared upon this pick for days now, and all that resides in my mind is a desire to meet its maker

name: Tome of the Blood Blade
description: To attune to this item, you must spend a short rest bleeding upon this book. During the attunement, take 3 hit dice worth of necrotic damage and let your blood flow. Once you’re attuned to it, you can use a bonus action to summon the Blood Blade. </br></br>Once summoned, the Blood Blade takes the form of a scimitar made of coagulated blood. On hit, the Blood Blade does an additional 2d6 piercing damage. On a kill, you can choose to heal for 1d6 health or deal an additional 1d6 on your next attack.
lore: The pages feel soggy and the ink reeks of iron, yet I feel compelled to read it, to study it, to devour it.

name: Morbius' Cape
description: Once per short rest you can fully negate fall damage
lore: The iconic cape from the iconic vampire. It even has some residual morbin’ juice on it from the last time he morbed.

name: Cape of the Mouuntebank
description: Once per long rest, you can cast the spell Dimension Door on yourself.
lore: After wearing it for a few days, you notice the faint smell of brimstone lingering around you.

name: Cloud Scarf of Firbolgs
description: While attuned, you gain proficiency in dexterity saving throws and acrobatics. Once per day, you can use an action to activate the scarf. While active, you gain an additional 5ft reach. This lasts for 1 hour.
lore: It’s soft and cozy, wrapped around your neck. Like a hug from the sky.

name: Gargoyle's Checkboard
description: When two parties shake over this checkerboard, a game of ADVANCED CHECKERS begins. The loser loses the hand they shook with.
lore: A game made for kings, but played by jesters.

name: Seeing Stone
description: A collection of polished magic stones that work across any distance or plane. When you look through one, you can choose any other seeing stone to see through, as if you were standing in its place.
lore: Whoever stares in will always be greeted by someone staring back.

name: Ghost Parrot
description: The parrot has 4 charges, and you can use an action to have the parrot speak and expend a charge to create an eerie, spellbinding tune. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that hears the tune must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom Saving Throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw is immune to the parrot for 24 hours. At dawn, the parrot regains 1d4 charges.
lore: Riddled with misfortune, the ghost parrot is seen as an omen of death by sailors. This has led to abandonment and abuse, leaving the parrot forever lonely in its afterlife.

name: Beholder's Bane Ruby
description: Once per long rest, you can use your reaction to activate the Ruby. When activated, any magical effects within 5 feet of the Ruby are immune to antimagic effects.
lore: Plundered from the nightmares of a beholder, these rubies are not from this plane nor this universe. A pure dream concoction.

name: Winewood Figurine
description: Upon speaking the figurine’s command word, a White Stallion Warhorse is summoned in its place. If the command word is spoken while the warhorse is still alive, it transforms back into the figurine. However, if the warhorse dies, you must wait until after a short rest to summon it again.
lore: Carved from wood hailing from the Fruit Court, this figurine contains the embodiment of an ideal stallion.

name: Banner of the Krig Rune
description: A red banner with the Krig Rune (Jotun Rune of War) dead center. For the rune to be active, the banner must be unfurled via an action. However, if the banner is affixed to a pole that is at least 10ft long, it can be permanently unfurled. While unfurled:</br>You can see all invisible creatures within 20ft of the banner</br>As a bonus action, you can cause the banner to emanate courage. This causes you and all allies within 20ft to be immune to the frightened condition. This lasts for 10 minutes and can be done 1/short rest.</br>As a bonus action, you can invoke the banner’s defensive might. Any ranged attack roll that targets you or an ally has disadvantage as long as the target is within 20ft of the banner. This lasts for 1 minute and can be done 1/short rest.</br></br>Lastly, you can transfer the banner's magic to a place by tracing the krig rune on the ground with your finger. The point where you trace it becomes the center of a spherical area of magic that has a 500-foot radius and that is fixed to the place. The transfer takes 8 hours of work that requires the banner to be within 5 feet of you during which you choose creatures, creature types, or both that will benefit from the magic. In the end, the banner is destroyed, and the area gains the following property:</br>While in the 500-foot-radius sphere, the creatures you chose during the transfer process are immune to the frightened condition and gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and AC.
lore: This rune has touched the fingers of all the great Giant Warlords of Old, and their knowledge and prowess will soon flow to you.

name: Skull Lord Skull
description: Once attuned, you gain resistance to cold, lightning, necrotic, and poison damage. After 1d10 days, the skull disintegrates.
lore: While you sleep, you can hear a faint cackling echoing in your dreams…
curse: Cursed </br> Always start with 2 failed death saving throws

name: Horn of the Winter Spirit
description: As a free action (even as a reaction when you drop to 0 hp), you break the horn of the Winter Spirit in half, becoming engulfed in primordial power. For one minute, you transform into the Avatar of the Winter Spirit. Your skin becomes an icy blue, you grow larger than life, and wherever you step snow appears. Once the minute is up, your body disintegrates into a snowy powder. The following are the powers gained while transformed:</br>Increase maximum HP by 150 and increase your size to Large or Huge (your choice)</br>Gain all the benefits of a long rest, 2 Legendary Resistances, an immunity to cold damage, and an additional turn in initiative</br>At any point, you can change the damage type of any attack or spell to cold</br>Gain the passive Aura of Hoarfrost: When a creature ends its turn within 60ft of you, you can choose to make it roll a DC 21 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 6d8 cold damage and becomes vulnerable to thunder, cold, and bludgeoning damage until the end of its next turn. If it fails by 5 or more, it is also restrained until the end of its next turn. A creature killed while restrained from this aura shatters, destroying its body. On a success, it takes half damage only.</br>Gain the breath attack Frigid Breath (Recharge 5-6): You exhale a 30-foot cone of frigid air. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 21 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 cold plus 6d8 thunder damage on a failed save, or take half as much damage on a success.</br>Gain the reaction Icy Refraction: When you are forced to make a saving throw against a spell, you may cast a copy of it, using the original caster’s save DC. The original spell takes effect first.
lore: Winter will rejoice in its newfound home.

name: Camembert du Bongo
description: While attuned, you gain a +2 to your spell save attack and spell save DC. Additionally, once per day, you may use an action to regain a use of Bardic Inspiration.
lore: It’s made with love, and love is always the most delicious ingredient.

name: Gem of Incalculable Wealth
description: The gem may be used as any spell component that has a gold cost, without the gem being consumed in the process. However, after the spell has been cast, the gem cannot be used in the same way for a number of days = 1d4*spell lvl. Additionally, if you attempt to sell this item, the buyer must succeed on a DC 18 INT Save or fall under a spell of madness due to trying to calculate its large worth. While mad, the buyer shows great fear, anger, and sadness towards the gem and its owner for 1 minute.
lore: This color. This clarity. This cut. This carat. By God!

name: Bead of Force
description: You can use an action to throw the bead up to 60 feet. The bead explodes on impact and is destroyed. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of where the bead landed must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 5d4 force damage. A sphere of transparent force then encloses the area for 1 minute. Any creature that failed the save and is completely within the area is trapped inside this sphere. Creatures that succeeded on the save, or are partially within the area, are pushed away from the center of the sphere until they are no longer inside it. Only breathable air can pass through the sphere's wall. No attack or other effect can.</br></br>An enclosed creature can use its action to push against the sphere's wall, moving the sphere up to half the creature's walking speed. The sphere can be picked up, and its magic causes it to weigh only 1 pound, regardless of the weight of creatures inside.
lore: In your hand, they shake and shiver and quiver, their magic energy compressed and immense.

name: Staff of the Magi
description: It’s broken. Split right in two. Extraplanar energy pours out of its fractured halves.
lore: Even the artifacts of past ages cannot withstand the foolishness that comes with pride. Pride and Wizardry, name a more perfect couple.

name: Death Knight's Maul
description: You have advantage on saving throws and other magical effects. On top of that, your strength increases by 2. Lastly, due to being forged with Baatorian Great Steel, this maul deals 2d8 instead of 2d6.
lore: “That which comes forth from such a foul beast shall be purged with no hesitation. No matter the strength, courage, or vitality it grants, those who think they can wield it only display their true colors to others: Cowardice.” - Bulwark of Yurian

name: Corundum Totem
description: Once per day as a bonus action, your skin hardens into pure corundum. This grants you resistance to all damage, if you already have resistance it turns into immunity, for 1 minute. However, if you fall to 0 hp while transformed, the totem cracks and breaks while also granting you an automatic failed Death Saving Throw. You may end the transformation as a free action.
lore: The Mythical Duergar Kingdom of Gracklstugh ruled over the entire Underdark at their peak. Now all that remains are their artifacts. The Corundum Totem is part of a set of 4 totems called the Pillars of Planets. Multiple Totems of this set can be forged together to combine their abilities into one item.

name: King Faenor's Maul
description: Deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage but you have disadvantage on the attack if you aren’t size huge or greater.
lore: In my memory, he still was great. He never failed. Never got the madness. Never had his fall from grace.

name: Amulet of Magic Resistance
description: Grants advantage on all saving throws against spells and magical effects
lore: It's kind of slimy and drips onto my shirt. But, it does help against those pesky monsters…

name: Froghemoth Hide
description: Grants resistance to fire and lightning damage.
lore: Interesting. When I wear this around Bullywugs they don’t attack. Instead, they offer me sacrifices. This must be studied further.

name: Mishi-Peshu Pelt
description: Grants 60ft of darkvision to the wearer.
lore: Gather round kids as I tell you the tale of how I wrestled the Fearsome Mishi-Peshu and got this gruesome scar!

name: Wings of Flying
description: You can use an action to transform the cloak into a pair of Roc Wings for 1 hour or until you use an action to dismiss them. The wings give you a flying speed of 60 ft. When they disappear, you can’t use them again for 1d12 hours.
lore: We're soarin'</br>Flyin'</br>There's not a star in heaven</br>That we can't reach

name: Roc Brooch
description: As a reaction, you activate the Roc Brooch for 10 minutes. While active, it grants the holder immunity to fall damage and the holder only falls 60ft per round (instead of 500ft). Once used, you can’t use it again for 1d12 hours.
lore: Building: Survived. Canyon: Survived. Mountain: Survived.

name: Leon Plate
description: When worn, you gain advantage on Wisdom Saving Throws. Additionally, the Leon Plate has a maximum of three charges. As a reaction to being hit by a melee or ranged attack, you can spend a charge and make the attack deal minimum damage. You gain three charges on a long rest.
lore: Some say the lion centered on the chest plate symbolizes valor. Others resilience. For me, it stands for my ironclad will.

name: Armor of Resistance
description: Each day at dawn, choose one of the chromatic damage types to become resistant to.
lore: The rainbow is magical. Its brilliance cannot be quantified or replicated. But this comes close.

name: Prismhawk Brooch
description: As a reaction to failing a saving throw, you can activate the brooch and, instead, pass the saving throw. Then, roll a d6 and gain a weakness to the corresponding damage on the table below. After a long rest, you may remove one weakness.
lore: Day 9. Even being near a candle hurts. I will never be rid of this fragility.

name: Prismhawk Helmet
description: Grants perception proficiency. Additionally, when rolling death saving throws in sunlight, treat a roll of 7 or higher as a success and a 19-20 as a critical success.
lore: May the sun, in all its glory, shine down upon me, casting all my shadows, faults, and demons to bleakness, and lift up my groveling body for another day.

name: Prismhawk Greataxe
description: Grants perception proficiency. Additionally, when rolling death saving throws in sunlight, treat a roll of 7 or higher as a success and a 19-20 as a critical success.
lore: May the sun, in all its glory, shine down upon me, casting all my shadows, faults, and demons to bleakness, and lift up my groveling body for another day.

name: Chaac's Platemail
description: Grants immunity to lightning damage. When you are hit by lightning damage, your movement speed doubles until the end of your next turn.
lore: When lighting strikes, it is not thunder that roars, but you.

name: Wand of Lightning
description: This wand has 8 maximum charges, and at dawn gains 1d6+1. As an action, you can spend 3 charges to cast Lightning Bolt or 6 charges to cast Chain Lightning. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend. If you expend this wand’s last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand is destroyed.
lore: Though it looks more like a lightning rod than a wand, you can’t help but feel wizardly while wielding.

name: Plasma Gauntlet
description: The gauntlet has a maximum of three charges. When you hit a melee attack, you gain one charge. When you make a melee attack you can spend three charges to gain advantage on that attack. Once per long rest, you can cast the spell Lightning Bolt with a DC 15 save.
lore: Copper is the best dancer when it rains.

name: Plasma Cannon
description: This martial ranged weapon (Range 120/360, Reload 2, two-handed) deals 6d8 lightning damage on hit. It requires a Concentrated Tempest Cartridge (CTC), a magically jarred thunderstorm, for ammunition, which costs 1000gp each.
lore: “Are you sure this is safe? My hair’s standing up.”</br>“Come on! Don’t be chicken, it's just a little shock.”
